conclusion: Identify forces acting on points C and D.
Distance between A and B is 2L; ropes AC and BD are each of length L.
Establish equilibrium at point C: vertical components of tension balance weight mg.
Establish equilibrium at point D: horizontal component of tension balances force F.
Relate angles and lengths: cos(θ) = 1/2, θ = 60°.
Determine minimum force F using horizontal component.
